network.loading: Afhængigt af netværkets størrelse og kvaliteten af dets links kan dette tage et stykke tid.
network.copy_paste_on: Kopier og indsæt følgende data i en af de tilgængelige online viewere/editorer.
network.highlight_info: Klik på en enheds billede for automatisk at fremhæve den.
network.legend_node_siblings: Kun de højest vurderede søskende vises, hvilket groft skulle matche de faktiske forbindelser i netværket.
network.legend_node_select: Valg af en node vil vælge den afhængige et-hop del af netværket.
network.legend_node_fold: Node kontekstmenu fold/udvid knap vil påvirke den afhængige del af netværket.
network.legend_edge_toggle: Skiftning af relationskanter vil ændre layoutet. Ved deaktivering af en eller flere, er det faktiske layout af netværket ikke længere nøjagtigt repræsenteret.
network.begin_info_type: Typen bruges til at hente et andet netværkskort format. Eksterne er beregnet til at blive kopieret til brug uden for frontend (nogle eksempel hjemmesider gives når genereret).
network.begin_info_routes: Aktivering af ruter vil hente rutetabellen fra enheder (ikke alle koordinatorer/enheder understøtter dette, men fejl bør ikke forhindre resten af dataene i at indlæse). Dette bruges i øjeblikket kun i 'data' visningen.
network.begin_info_display: Visningstypen tillader at skifte mellem en data-orienteret visning og en kortvisning.

ota.update_selected_info: En OTA opdatering er meget belastende for et netværk. Sørg for at det er stabilt og vælg mindre brugte tider.
ota.empty_ota_message: Ingen enhed understøtter i øjeblikket OTA
ota.schedule_info: Vil opdatere ved næste OTA anmodning fra enhed

settings.donation_text: Her kan du takke os for alt det hårde arbejde. Tøv ikke med at sige noget rart også ;)
settings.translation_prompt: Du kan hjælpe med oversættelsen på
settings.frontend_notice: Disse indstillinger gemmes lokalt i din browser. Brug af private vinduer eller rydning af cache vil nulstille dem til standard.

health.interview_info: Enhed interviews can heavily influence this data.

zigbee.force_remove_notice: Brug kun som sidste udvej (forplanter sig ikke til netværket)
zigbee.read_write_attributes: Read / Skriv attributter from endpoint cluster

devConsole.state_property_info: Sæt resultatet ind i enhedens tilstand (kun til læsning)
devConsole.mqtt_topic_info: Udelad 'base_topic', frontend beskeder sendes over WebSocket direkte til Zigbee2MQTT.
devConsole.codespace_info: A Github Codespace is available to help in development

settingsSchemaDescriptions.homeassistant-legacy_action_sensor: Home Assistant legacy actions sensor, when enabled a action sensor will be discoverd and an empty `action` will be send after every published action.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.homeassistant-experimental_event_entitie: Home Assistant experimental event entities, when enabled Zigbee2MQTT will add event entities for exposed actions. The events and attributes are currently deemed experimental and subject to change.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.availability-active-timeout: Tid hvorefter en aktiv enhed markeres som offline i minutter
settingsSchemaDescriptions.availability-active-max_jitter: Maksimal jitter (i ms) tilladt på timeout for at undgå at tilgængelighedspings forsøger at udløse på samme tid
settingsSchemaDescriptions.availability-active-backoff: Aktiver timeout-backoff ved mislykkede tilgængelighedspings (x1.5, x3, x6, x12...)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.availability-active-pause_on_backoff_gt: Pause tilgængelighedspings når backoff når over denne grænse indtil en ny Zigbee-besked modtages fra enheden. En værdi på nul deaktiverer pause.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.availability-passive-timeout: Tid hvorefter en passiv enhed markeres som offline i minutter
settingsSchemaDescriptions.mqtt-base_topic: MQTT base topic for Zigbee2MQTT MQTT messages
settingsSchemaDescriptions.mqtt-server: MQTT server URL (use mqtts:// for SSL/TLS connection)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.mqtt-ca: Absolute path to SSL/TLS certificate of CA used to sign server and client certificates
settingsSchemaDescriptions.mqtt-key: Absolute path to SSL/TLS key for client-authentication
settingsSchemaDescriptions.mqtt-cert: Absolute path to SSL/TLS certificate for client-authentication
settingsSchemaDescriptions.mqtt-include_device_information: Include device information to mqtt messages
settingsSchemaDescriptions.mqtt-force_disable_retain: Disable retain for all send messages. ONLY enable if your MQTT broker doesn't support retained message (e.g. AWS IoT core, Azure IoT Hub, Google Cloud IoT core, IBM Watson IoT Platform). Enabling will break the Home Assistant integration
settingsSchemaDescriptions.mqtt-maximum_packet_size: Specifies the maximum allowed packet length (in bytes) that the server can send to Zigbee2MQTT. NOTE: The same value exists in your MQTT broker but for the length the client can send to it instead.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.serial-port: Placering af adapteren. For at registrere porten automatisk, sæt null
settingsSchemaDescriptions.serial-adapter: Adaptertype, ikke nødvendig medmindre du oplever problemer
settingsSchemaDescriptions.serial-baudrate: Baudhastighed for serielport. Dette skal matche hvad firmwaren på din adapter understøtter (oftest 115200).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.serial-rtscts: RTS / CTS Hardware Flow Control for serielport
settingsSchemaDescriptions.blocklist: Block devices from the network (by ieeeAddr)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.passlist: Allow only certain devices to join the network (by ieeeAddr). Note that all devices not on the passlist will be removed from the network!
settingsSchemaDescriptions.ota-update_check_interval: Din enhed kan anmode om et tjek for en ny firmware-opdatering. Denne værdi bestemmer hvor ofte tredjepartsservere faktisk kan kontaktes for at lede efter firmware-opdateringer. Værdien sættes i minutter, og standarden er 1 dag.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.ota-disable_automatic_update_check: Zigbee devices may request a firmware update, and do so frequently, causing Zigbee2MQTT to reach out to third party servers. If you disable these device initiated checks, you can still initiate a firmware update check manually.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.ota-zigbee_ota_override_index_location: Location of override OTA index file
settingsSchemaDescriptions.ota-image_block_response_delay: Limits the rate of requests (in milliseconds) during OTA updates to reduce network congestion. You can increase this value if your network appears unstable during OTA.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.ota-default_maximum_data_size: The size of file chunks sent during an update (in bytes). Note: This value may get ignored for manufacturers that require specific values.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.frontend-port: Frontend binding port. Ignored when using a unix domain socket
settingsSchemaDescriptions.frontend-host: Frontend binding host. Binds to a unix socket when an absolute path is given instead.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.frontend-url: URL on which the frontend can be reached, currently only used for the Home Assistant device configuration page
settingsSchemaDescriptions.frontend-ssl_cert: SSL Certificate file path for exposing HTTPS. The sibling property 'ssl_key' must be set for HTTPS to be activated.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.frontend-ssl_key: SSL key file path for exposing HTTPS. The sibling property 'ssl_cert' must be set for HTTPS to be activated.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.frontend-base_url: Base URL for the frontend. If hosted under a subpath, e.g. 'http://localhost:8080/z2m', set this to '/z2m'
settingsSchemaDescriptions.frontend-notification_filter: Hide frontend notifications matching specified regex strings. Example: 'z2m: Failed to ping.*'
settingsSchemaDescriptions.frontend-disable_ui_serving: If true, the frontend UI is not served, only the WebSocket is maintained by Zigbee2MQTT (you are required to serve a standalone UI yourself as needed).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-log_symlink_current: Create symlink to current logs in the log directory
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-log_output: Output-placering for loggen, lad stå tom for at undertrykke logning
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-log_namespaced_levels: Sæt individuelle logniveauer for bestemte navnerum
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-log_debug_to_mqtt_frontend: Log debug level to MQTT and frontend (may decrease overall performance)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-log_debug_namespace_ignore: Log ikke disse navnerum (regex-baseret) for debug-niveau
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-log_directories_to_keep: Antal log-mapper at beholde før sletning af den ældste
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-log_syslog-host: The host running syslogd, defaults to localhost.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-log_syslog-port: The port on the host that syslog is running on, defaults to syslogd's default port.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-log_syslog-protocol: The network protocol to log over (e.g. tcp4, udp4, tls4, unix, unix-connect, etc).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-log_syslog-path: The path to the syslog dgram socket (i.e. /dev/log or /var/run/syslog for OS X).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-log_syslog-pid: PID of the process that log messages are coming from (Default process.pid).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-log_syslog-localhost: Host to indicate that log messages are coming from (Default: localhost).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-log_syslog-type: The type of the syslog protocol to use (Default: BSD, also valid: 5424).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-log_syslog-app_name: The name of the application (Default: Zigbee2MQTT).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-log_syslog-eol: The end of line character to be added to the end of the message (Default: Besked without modifications).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-pan_id: ZigBee pan-ID, ændring kræver genparring af alle enheder!
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-ext_pan_id: Zigbee udvidet pan-ID, ændring kræver genparring af alle enheder!
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-channel: Zigbee-kanal, ændring kan kræve genparring af nogle enheder! (Bemærk: brug en ZLL-kanal: 11, 15, 20 eller 25 for at undgå problemer)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-adapter_concurrent: Adapter concurrency (e.g. 2 for CC2531 or 16 for CC26X2R1) (default: null, uses recommended value)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-cache_state: MQTT message payload will contain all attributes, not only changed ones. Has to be true when integrating via Home Assistant
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-cache_state_persistent: Bevar cachet tilstand, bruges kun når cache_state: true
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-cache_state_send_on_startup: Send cachet tilstand ved opstart, bruges kun når cache_state: true
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-last_seen: Add a last_seen attribute to MQTT messages, contains date/time of last Zigbee message
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-elapsed: Add an elapsed attribute to MQTT messages, contains milliseconds since the previous msg
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-network_key: Netværk encryption key, changing requires re-pairing all devices!
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-transmit_power: Transmit power of adapter, only available for Z-Stack (CC253*/CC2652/CC1352) adapters, CC2652 = 5dbm, CC1352 max is = 20dbm (5dbm default)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.advanced-output: Examples when 'state' of a device is published json: topic: 'zigbee2mqtt/my_bulb' payload '{"state": "ON"}' attribute: topic 'zigbee2mqtt/my_bulb/state' payload 'ON' attribute_and_json: both json and attribute (see above)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.health: Periodically check the health of Zigbee2MQTT
settingsSchemaDescriptions.health-reset_on_check: If true, will reset stats every time the health check is executed (only applicable to stats that can be reset).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.definitions-device-friendly_name: Used in the MQTT topic of a device. By default this is the device ID
settingsSchemaDescriptions.definitions-device-retain: Retain MQTT messages of this device
settingsSchemaDescriptions.definitions-device-disabled: Deaktivers the device (excludes device from network scans, availability and group state updates)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.definitions-device-retention: Sets the MQTT Message Expiry in seconds, Make sure to set mqtt.version to 5
settingsSchemaDescriptions.definitions-device-qos: QoS level for MQTT messages of this device
settingsSchemaDescriptions.definitions-device-throttle: The minimum time between payloads in seconds. Payloads received whilst the device is being throttled will be discarded
settingsSchemaDescriptions.definitions-device-debounce_ignore: Protects unique payload values of specified payload properties from overriding within debounce time
settingsSchemaDescriptions.definitions-device-filtered_attributes: Filter attributes with regex from published payload.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.definitions-device-filtered_cache: Filter attributes with regex from being added to the cache, this prevents the attribute from being in the published payload when the value didn't change.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.definitions-device-filtered_optimistic: Filter attributes with regex from optimistic publish payload when calling /set. (This has no effect if optimistic is set to false).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.definitions-device-icon: The user-defined device icon for the frontend. It can be a full URL link to an image (e.g. https://SOME.SITE/MODEL123.jpg) or a path to a local file inside the `device_icons` directory (e.g. device_icons/MODEL123.png).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.definitions-device-homeassistant-name: Name of the device in Home Assistant
settingsSchemaDescriptions.definitions-group-qos: QoS level for MQTT messages of this group
settingsSchemaDescriptions.definitions-group-off_state: Control when to publish state OFF or CLOSE for a group. 'all_members_off': only publish state OFF/CLOSE when all group members are in state OFF/CLOSE,  'last_member_state': publish state OFF whenever one of its members changes to OFF
